wiki.content:
"Bleeding Heart" (sometimes called "My Bleeding Heart") is a song written and recorded by American blues musician Elmore James in 1961. Considered among the greatest of James' songs, "Bleeding Heart" was later popularized by Jimi Hendrix, who put down on record several versions of the song. The version released on his 1994 compilation "Blues" is a slow-burning electric jam recorded in 1969 with his Band of Gypsys.  
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Bleeding Heart" (sometimes called "My Bleeding Heart") is a song written and recorded by American blues musician Elmore James in 1961. Considered among the greatest of James' songs, "Bleeding Heart" was later popularized by Jimi Hendrix, who put down on record several versions of the song. The version released on his 1994 compilation "Blues" is a slow-burning electric jam recorded in 1969 with his Band of Gypsys.

track.name: Bleeding Heart
comments: The version I'm listening to is a bit shite. Morrison ruins it.
If Jimi would've lived he would be playing some really great blues today just like in this song & he always loved the blues.
That's Jimbo Morrison, obliterated beyond belief! Prost.

Jimi is the greatest guitarist.

sounds like its from live at the scene club NY 1969, its a late night jam with jimi and morrison drunk as hell, on a few tracks yelling

Correct not on my copy of Blues.  Could be part of a reissue?  More likely Last.fm is playing tricks this is a live cut and they seem to find a lot of like songs and add them to albums.   Audio quality blows.
Great track - but it's definitely NOT on the Blues album - nothing with Jim Morrison on that album
Jimi and that Strat made magic together.
